solution_line_template: Jesse runs 2 miles in the first three days because {jesse_days_first} x {jesse_avg_first} = <<{jesse_days_first}*{jesse_avg_first}={jesse_miles_first}>>{jesse_miles_first}
Jesse has 18 miles left to run because {total_miles} - {jesse_day4} - {jesse_miles_first} = <<{total_miles}-{jesse_day4}-{jesse_miles_first}={jesse_miles_left}>>{jesse_miles_left}
Jesse has to run an average of 6 miles a day because {jesse_miles_left} / {days_left} = <<{jesse_miles_left}/{days_left}={jesse_avg_final}>>{jesse_avg_final}
Mia runs 12 miles over the first four days because {mia_days_first} x {mia_avg_first} = <<{mia_days_first}*{mia_avg_first}={mia_miles_first}>>{mia_miles_first}
She has 18 miles left to run because {total_miles} - {mia_miles_first} = <<{total_miles}-{mia_miles_first}={mia_miles_left}>>{mia_miles_left}
She has to run six miles a day because {mia_miles_left} / {days_left} = <<{mia_miles_left}/{days_left}={mia_avg_final}>>{mia_avg_final}
The total they both have to run is <<12=12>>{total_avg_final} miles a day
The average they have to run per day on average is 6 miles because {total_avg_final} / {num_runners} = <<{total_avg_final}/{num_runners}={answer}>>{answer}
